intro: Callista tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered callista, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
